intro: Scleranthus leiphaemus, commonly known as the pale sand-rocket, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are pale yellow to white in color. Scleranthus leiphaemus is an annual plant that blooms from spring to early summer.
